drawableStateChanged().Description: This function is called whenever the state of the view changes in such a way that it impacts the state of drawables being shown. If the View has a StateListAnimator, it will also be called to run necessary state change animations. Be sure to call through to the superclass when overriding this function.

TintButton(android.content.Context, andr.FullName: public TintButton (Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr)

ClassDesc: An tint aware @B_android#widget#Button_E@. This will automatically be used when you use @B_android#widget#Button_E@ in your layouts. You should only need to manually use this class when writing custom views.
